de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.worker
Class FacetUpdater

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.SwingWorker<MetaClass,java.lang.Void>
      de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.worker.FacetUpdater
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<MetaClass>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<MetaClass>
public class FacetUpdater
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<MetaClass,java.lang.Void>

The job of this background task is to fetch all factes belonging to an artefact. The job is initiated by the tester when he or she clicks in the tree component to an available node. That node becomes the selected node and is passed down here to the controller layer. The first thing to do is to transform the selected node to an proper artefact type and get its corresponding facets. When this is done properly the result is returned to the UI and displayed in a table fasioned way.

Worker Thread
As with tedious work, the system does this in background. There are more reasons to consider. Either the EDT gets stuck computing the results, or the user gets annoyed by not responding GUI elements.

Since:
Apr/21/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Constructor Detail

FacetUpdater

public FacetUpdater(javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                    javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode selectedNode,
                    DataGeneratorView view)
constructor is passed the name of the selected node. The node itself comes from the tree component in the UI. The job here is to get all facets to that artefact and display it in a table fashion.

Parameters:
path - represents the path to a node
selectedNode - selected node to get the latest update on facets.
view - reference to main view, where the facets are displayed in its proper fashion.
